Detailed Description

Pixel-Based Light Manager.

This is the advanced pixel-based light manager, it provides ways to draw and manage pixel-based lights.

See also:
PhVertexLightManager

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phoenix::PhLightManager::PhLightManager ( PhSceneManager *  s,
PhVector2d  ts = PhVector2d(256, 256) 
)

Constructor.

Creates a new light manager. A light manager is usually automatically created by the scenemanager at initialization time.

Parameters:
s Pointer to the Scenemanager that manages this.
ts The size of the texture buffer that stores the light data.
See also:
PhSceneManager::getLightManager()

virtual phoenix::PhLightManager::~PhLightManager (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

Deletes all the lights in the list.

Member Function Documentation

void phoenix::PhLightManager::addLight ( PhLight *  l  ) 

Add light.

Adds a light to the manager, this is usually taken care of the the Light itself: Created lights must register themselves with the light manager to be down (Similar to scenenodes).

Parameters:
l Pointer the the light to add.
See also:
removeLight(),clearLights()

void phoenix::PhLightManager::clearLights (  ) 

Clear light.

Removes all the lights from the manager.

See also:
addLight(),clearLights()

void phoenix::PhLightManager::generateBuffer (  ) 

Generate buffer.

This draws all the lights on to the texture buffer to later be overlayed over the scene. This function should be called before anything else is drawn, as it clears the backbuffer. This function is automatically called by PhSceneManager at the right time if lights are enabled.

See also:
PhSceneManager::drawAll(), renderBuffer()

PhTexture* phoenix::PhLightManager::getBuffer (  ) 

Get buffer.

Returns:
A pointer to the texture currently being used as a buffer for drawing lights.
See also:
generateBuffer(), renderBuffer()

PhSceneManager* phoenix::PhLightManager::getSceneManager (  ) 

Get scenemanager.

Returns:
A pointer to the scenemanager that manages us.

void phoenix::PhLightManager::removeLight ( PhLight *  l  ) 

Remove light.

Removes a light from the manager, this is usually taken care of the Light when it is destructed, similar to scenenodes.

Parameters:
l Pointer to the light to remove.
See also:
addLight(),clearLights()

void phoenix::PhLightManager::renderBuffer (  ) 

Render buffer.

This renders the buffer that all the lights were rendered to over the scene (at a depth of 99.0f). This should be called after everything else is draw. This function is automatically called by PhSceneeManager after the onRender() step and before the onPostRender() step if lights are enabled.

See also:
PhSceneManager::drawAll(), generateBuffer()
